alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:21PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Tuscaloosa County through 300 PM CDT... At 221 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coaling, or 8 miles east of Holt, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brookwood, Coaling, Vance, Mercedes Benz Of Alabama, Lake Wildwood, Abernant, North Bibb, East Brookwood, Camp Horne B.S.A., I 20 Rest Area Near Tuscaloosa and Cedar Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
